subject: Re: [junit] Thanks
msgSnippet: ... When an assert fails, an exception is thrown - the method is exited. The second assert is not evaluated.  This is a JUnit feature and not a bug.  This is
messageBody:
>
>
>When i write
>junit program the two assert i written should fail
>according to the test but when i run the program only
>one failure is occured then when i correct that
>failure and again run the program the second failure
>occured, what i pretended to say is whether it shows
>the failure overall in a single run or it shows the
>failure line by line. I need your thought.
>
When an assert fails, an exception is thrown -> the method is exited.
The second assert is not evaluated. This is a JUnit feature and not a
bug. This is also compliant with the new assert keyword in Jdk 1.4 (and
the exception thrown when this assert fails)

-Vladimir
